headline: King Charles
subHeadline: Nikki Haley Says, U.S. Has Never Been A Racist Country; Maggie Haberman Talks With Gayle And Charles; Roy Wood Jr. And Jordan Klepper Talk With Gayle And Charles; Comedians Roy Wood, Jr. And Jordan Klepper Share Their View On Politics And Racism; Actor Niecy Nash Shares Her Joy Winning An Emmy. Aired 10-11p ET

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: That source that says the actor was brought to a bank to prepay potential taxes on the timepiece.The Terminator does not appear to be too phased by what happened to him. He posted this picture afterward, feeding a cookie to his pet pig. We'll keep you updated on that important story and all of them. Thank you so much for joining us for this busy new hour. A brand new episode of King Charles starts right now.

utterances.speaker: CHARLES BARKLEY, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes, 2024 is here. This is our first show of the year. We are glad to be back. You know, we were preempted last week about a debate. I know you all really watched that thing. But we're ready to start the New Year off right, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: GAYLE KING, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: I say here's to more in 2024. But just in that open trials, it just caught me. It said, you said, I love karaoke. Do you do karaoke?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I do. Frank Sinatra.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You do?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I do Frank Sinatra.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What is the song that you do?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I do New York, New York, New York and My Way. But, you know, I've been doing Kane Brown lately.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I love Kane Brown. I love him.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. I've been doing Heaven my last couple appearances.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I love Kane Brown.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm a big Kane Brown fan. But I love karaoke.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Do you care to share with the class?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well you have to be drunk and happy we had the words.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Nobody does karaoke sober.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay. Listen, I do karaoke sober if I do it. I have a terrible voice, but I love karaoke.But this is the thing. I say here's to more in 2024. I don't have any New Year's resolutions. Do you have one?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know I'm trying to give up Diet Coke.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay. And how many Diet Cokes have you had in the last hour? Well, number one, how many Diet Cokes do you drink a day normally?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: 15 to 20. I'm trying, Gayle. I'm an addict. I'm trying to stop.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: 15 to 20 a day?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've only had since we got here at 3

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Charles, this is not good for you. Honestly, this is not good for you.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It tastes so good, though. Yes, I just love Diet Coke. I really do.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We have so much to get to tonight. It's funny because, you know, people say to me, I watch the show, I really like the show. People ask me all the time, are you worried about what Charles is going to say?I was on Amtrak, a guy, Tom, I think was his name, said he's like a muffler, you don't know what's going to come out. And I always say this, Charles, you know exactly what you're doing at all times. You never say anything just for click bait, you never say anything just to be provocative. True?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: 100 percent. I know, number one, what I want to say, and I know what the reaction is going to be. Because what I try to do, to be honest with you, I know if I'm going to start a fire. But I really just try to start a conversation.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: And I can say, I don't tell people, you're not right or wrong all the time, but part of being in our position, like I just want to throw it out there, and then let's have a civilized conversation about it. But, yes, I always know the reaction of what I say.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I know. That's what I want people to know. You know, there's no -- you don't -- you are very authentic, you don't put on airs and you always speak the truth as you see it. BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And just because you say it, it doesn't mean --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It doesn't make it true.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, Roy, he's never introduced me to Trevor Noah. Trevor Noah is on my bucket list.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We would like to have Trevor Noah here. I think we could pick up the phone. Maybe he'll come.He's going to be here with Jordan Klepper. We're going to talk to them about the 2024 race, their experiences with voters, comedy, T.V., and Roy had a big moment on the Emmy stage the other day because they won an Emmy for the Trevor Noah Show. Trevor won an Emmy and they were both part of the Trevor Noah Show. The entire political world has moved into the tiny state of New Hampshire. Charles, we have to play something. I know you all saw this, what Nikki Haley said this week. Roll tape, please. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: NIKKI HALEY, REPUBLICAN PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: We're not a racist country, Brian. We've never been a racist country. Our goal is to make sure that today is better than yesterday.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We asked people out on the street about that tonight. We didn't find anyone that could agree with that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Not anybody with common sense.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, we didn't find anybody.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you know what, I've been having a hard time trying to decide who I'm going to vote for. So, Nikki Haley is the leader in the clubhouse because --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: She was a leader in your clubhouse.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because she's a hundred percent correct. If you forget about slavery, Jim Crow, segregation, anti-Semitism, Asian hate that's been going on in this country, America has been smooth sailing.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, that was --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I think a lot of people were surprised by that time.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: First of all, you can't be surprised. That was just stupid. America was built on racism. First of all --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: America was certainly built on slavery.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, certainly that. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But listen you can criticize a country. This is the greatest country in the world. You can still criticize it. Anybody who thinks we don't have racism, you turn on the T.V. every single day, there's racism. And for her, somebody who wants to be the president of the United States to set something that's stupid, and that's just stupid. Like I when you heard it, you're like, oh, can you -- I wish I could go back on my T.V. because, you know, some people, somebody --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: To rewind to see that you --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because you can't think that. You can't think that racism doesn't exist in this country. Right now, like I said, America was built on racism, segregation, Jim Crow, slavery, even now we've got anti-Semitism that's through the roof. In the last couple years, Asian people have been getting mistreated.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Well, she has a town hall tomorrow night, Jake Tapper.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know what I want to do?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What, what?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Listen, I want all the black people here in New York, we're going up to New Hampshire. We're going to have the whole audience black. That's what we're going to do. And when Jake Tapper said, we got a question, we're going to all raise our hand at the same time. If I could get -- it's cold out here right now. If I could get --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Something tells me there's not very many black people in New Hampshire, so maybe you might have to cover New York. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, I think that the reason she said that everything is rosy with black people, she'd been in New Hampshire and Iowa for the last two months, she ain't seen no black people. But, you know, listen, I'm so disappointed that she said that because it's 100 percent wrong.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, I would like to see her address that. We'll see. We'll see.Talk about a costly mistake, Arnold Schwarzenegger, we all know him, he was detained at an airport in Munich, Germany, the other day for more than two hours. Why? Because he failed to declare a watch reportedly valued it more than $20,000 upon his arrival. Has this ever happened to you? I've gone to an airport and they say do you have anything to declare, and I always say, no, I don't, and most of the time, I really don't. So, did this ever happened to you?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, it happens all the time. You just got to learn a lie and say -- when you go to a foreign country, you have to spend a whole night before peeling off the Cuban cigar labels. And then when the guy looks you and eye and says, Charles, are these Cubans? No, they're not. They're not Cuban. And then if you got a nice watch, no, I already had that watch. You have to lie.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Or you could just declare it.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, you're going to pay taxes on it then.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, you're going to pay taxes on it. Trust me, we pay enough taxes, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, you're encouraging people to lie.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: They do it all the time.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Well, I just have to say this. I was on a plane. Normally, if you're traveling out of the country, you cannot travel with more than $10,000 in cash. I never have $10,000 in cash, but I was on a plane with Oprah. She had $10,000 in cash and you're supposed to declare it. And so it was all the -- I don't like entourage, but all very close friends. And so she said, I have to declare it. I said, but it's your money. It doesn't make sense to me when it's your money.I said, why don't you split it up? Give me $2,000, give so and so $2,000, give me $3,000. And I am a law abiding citizen. And I said, no one will know. And she said, but I'll know, I'll know. And so she declared it.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: See that's -- I knew Oprah was too good to be true. That broke my heart right there.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I would have done that too.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's what I would have done. Coming up next, fresh off his victory in the Iowa caucus, we're going to talk to somebody who won a literal Pulitzer for her reporting on Donald Trump. We're talking about the great Maggie Haberman about where do we go from here. Lots of people got lots of questions.You're watching King Charles, we'll be right back. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: MAGGIE HABERMAN, CNN POLITICAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: pretty much. I mean, he has melded his legal cases and his political campaign, so they are indistinguishable. He fundraises off the legal cases. And this was a civil case. He didn't have to be there today.He chose to be there. This is not a criminal trial where he would have to be in court. But most of his supporters don't know the difference. They don't hear the difference. They just hear noise that he's under fire, and they tune in that way, and they give him money that way. And so he is really leaning into this because he has learned the lesson that there is a benefit to him politically.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Well, today in court, he seemed to want to get kicked out of court. Can you talk about what happened in court today?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Sure. So, he went to court --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: He seems to deliberately taunt the judge.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: It seemed very much like that to me. This was, again, the civil trial involving E. Jean Carroll, this New York writer who accused him of rape decades ago. And he was already found liable for sexual abuse and defamation in a previous case related to her that she brought.In this case, he showed up for her testimony. And so instead of us talking about her testimony, we are talking about the fact that he was making noises. He was over her whispering to his lawyer. The judge, Lou Kaplan, who is a very serious judge, he's been on the bench a very long time, and it's a federal court, it's not the same as a state court where things tend to be a little looser. This judge gave him warnings and said at one point, something to the effect of, I know you want to get thrown out and I'm not going to do that, and Trump responded, I would love that. And I suspect, Gayle, that that is true. He would have liked to have gotten thrown out because he would then claim he was a victim. It's heads he wins, tails, the other side loses.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: How long you been covering politics?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: 20-some odd years.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Have you ever, and I trust your expertise, seen candidates like him, you either love him or you hate him. Like there's no middle ground, like his people love him and everybody else hates him. Have you ever seen this type of firestorm?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: The only close to polarizing figure like Trump that I have seen ever at any level is Rudy Giuliani, whose city hall I covered for the final three years of his administration, and then I covered his presidential campaign, which was very different because he was covered post-911 in a different way nationally.But at city hall, he was incredibly polarizing, and he made a number of racist statements, and he was constantly at odds with black leaders, and he was constantly, reflexively pro-cop, no matter what the incident involving cops was. And that's the only thing that I can remember like this. But even still, it doesn't come close.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But this is what I struggle with, Maggie, covering him, and I'm curious about how you handle this. You know, I always think that you're always entitled to your own opinion, but you're not entitled to your own set of facts.How do you cover something where he's very fluid with the truth, as we know, and that it doesn't matter what he says, it doesn't matter that people will just believe anything that he says, even when it's been proven not to be true, how do you cover someone, or how do you present stories when the facts don't matter?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: So in the case of --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Is it hard for you?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: I think it's hard that there is no longer an objective fact set that is agreed upon in this country, and that became clear in 2016 that things were heading that way. It has devolved much worse since then.I think one of the starkest examples is that since he left office and since he has been telling his election lies about 2020 relentlessly, and he won't stop doing it, and I don't think he's going to stop doing it in this campaign, the number of Republicans who believe his version of events, both about the election and about what happened on January 6th, has really changed. And so that's the starkest example. I mean, it's incumbent upon us to tell the cleanest, clearest version of the truth that we can. But is it --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But does that matter?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Well, it matters in terms of how we do our jobs because that is our job. And how many people understand that or hear that? We can't do anything about it. All we can try to do is make sure that our stories are checked out and clear.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Have we ever had a candidate win a nomination and never did a debate?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: I really can't think of anything like this from somebody who wasn't an incumbent. He is running as if he's an incumbent and that's what --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And that does not hurt him. Not doing any debates does not hurt him.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Not doing any debates, doing minimal events in Iowa. I mean, he did, you know, something close to 30 events, but that's nothing compared to what the other candidates did. This is unprecedented and it is almost entirely and not only because he does have a strong base of support, but these indictments have galvanized his supporters in ways that did not become clear until the summer.

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: That is very much where we are. We're essentially -- you know, everything is divided by not just how you view certain policies over behavior or, you know, quote/unquote, right and wrong, it's -- his supporters will say what he does is right because what he's doing impacts them in the way that they want and makes their lives better.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You wrote a book about him. Do you have a rapport with him still? You seem to have had a rapport with him. HABERMAN

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: He called you the other day?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, for the first time in a long time. And I wrote him --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: To say what?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: He wanted to talk about these cases and these trials that he was going to. Because I was writing a story about how, you know, politics in the courts were going to converge again in January. This was a couple of weeks ago. And he called to say that he wanted to attend all of these trials and to talk, you know, again about his attacks on the judge and the civil case and to talk about E. Jean Carroll, much of which I didn't report on.But he thinks he's his own best comms director and his own best defender, and you'll see more of that as (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: One final question. As a mom, are you --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: As a mom and your kids going to be grow up in the next few years, are you hopeful about the next year?

utterances.speaker: HABERMAN
utterances.sentences: I think this is going to be a pretty bleak campaign on many levels. But I just think that the way that our campaigns are fought now are all about who you hate and who hates you back. And I think you are going to see that to the nth degree in 2024.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Right. To be continued.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you for taking the time.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. As we all know, it's stumping season, and it's not just Nikki Haley, Donald Trump and Joe Biden touring America. Comedians Jordan Klepper on my left, Roy Wood Jr. on my right, they're on the road too, talking to voters on their America for the Last Time Tour.That's quite the title, America for the Last Time Tour. Just -- Charles just rolls off the tongue.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It rolls off, didn't it?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You may know them from Comedy Central's political powerhouse, The Daily Show. And I'm not sure anybody has a better feel for what people want and what they are feeling right now. Roy and Jordan, we welcome you back to the show. And we should say congratulations because Trevor Noah won an Emmy, you all were part of that team. Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Thanks for introducing me to him, Roy.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We saw you on stage.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, I'm sorry, you didn't.ROY WOOD JR., COMEDIAN: Well, you could have come over to the show. It's right up the street, like we ain't right around the corner. Thank you for having me. Good to see you all again. And, Gayle, he tripping.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN KLEPPER, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Do you actually have Trevor's phone number?

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: I'm black.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: Okay. I was going to say, if you want to share that with me, I would take it. Any connection would be nice.

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: I'll tell him later about that.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: Okay, great.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We'll see what we can do. I'm black too. We'll see what we can do. I got his number too.Okay. But, anyway, Maggie Haberman was just here, guys, last break. Did anything she say jump out at you when we were talking about the political season, the campaign? Roy, you want to go first?

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think Maggie was spot on and talking about how emotions are driving the voter base now and not necessarily policy, you know. Jordan and I've had --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Or the truth?

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: Yes, the truth doesn't matter. Truth stopped mattering like five, six, seven years ago. Nobody care about truth anymore. It's just that's my guy or it's not that guy.And Jordan I've been out on tour and doing Q&As with some of the audiences and like we're out in Little America and people -- like I've never seen people more unexcited about two choices.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: We'll say it's going to be Trump versus Biden and nobody gets excited about that idea. Nobody wants this rematch. Biden is not --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: On either side, right?

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, I think on the Trump side, Trump already has his voters, has had his voters. I think the thing that --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But Trump voters seem pretty excited about him.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: They've already bought the hats. They're re-buying the hats. I talked to a man who bought a hat every single month, and they're not reformatting the hats. They keep rebooting the money game.On the left, though, we're definitely talking to people at our shows who are more progressive, and they want any other choice but Biden. And they don't feel he's a strong enough candidate, which is a bummer. He has some downsides. He has the whole Hunter Biden situation, which, in and of itself, is clearly going to be an albatross for him.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, they say they don't want either candidate on both sides. Who do they want? What does that person look like?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's a great question, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I'm serious. Who do they want? Yes.

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: It seems like everybody wants somebody younger, but I don't understand. Here's my question to you all. How is it that Biden is considered old, but Trump isn't?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, because --

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: Trump, he was like three, four years younger than Biden.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. But ages are totally different, Roy. You know that. One guy looks a lot younger, acts a lot younger, maybe to a fault, but they're basically the same age.

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: One guy moves old. The other guy talks concussed.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WOOD
utterances.sentences: So, I don't really -- it's just like, which level of coordination do you prefer, is what I feel like it comes down to.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's frustrating because these politicians to me, in my opinion, they've ruined the country, the Democrats and the Republicans, because they fight over every subject. Me and Jordan ain't ever met before. There's no way we'll disagree on -- and I'm just talking right now.No, because --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: There's no way you'll disagree on what?[22:30:03] BARKLEY: On every subject, like the repulse on the Democrats, like, you're watching TV, like, would they disagree on that? Like, I can meet a random stranger, but, and who's, like, man, let's have a conversation about something. There are some things we would actually agree on. Now, we could disagree, but the way these politicians have ruined this country, like, wait, if they want it, Maggie talked about it. We like our guy, we hate the other guy. I'm like, I don't hate --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I'm going to oppose it just because it was your idea.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Just because you came up with it. I'm like, no man, there's some things we're going to agree on, some things we're going to disagree on. And if we disagree, let's try to reach a happy medium. Because we're all Americans.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: See, because I hate the fact that you have to pick between being a Democrat and Republican. I think everybody should be an independent. And then you vote for the hell you want to. But our system is broken. Our system is broken. A lot of people agree with you on that. And it's really sad. Roy, let me ask you a question. You know, we had a couple, Wolf Blitz, John King. Why is President Biden struggling with black people?ROY WOOD, JR., COMEDIAN: I think that there are a lot of unfulfilled promises from the administration, at least that's how it feels with black people. I think also when you look at black people, I feel like as a group, we've always felt like we've always put our needs to the side for the greater good. You've always -- because you're always asked to vote for the best candidate, even if their platform isn't necessarily benefiting your particular group or your voter base. And I think at some point, like other voter bases, black people are like, no, we want ours now. We want some reparations. I tried to ask Biden for reparations at the correspondence dinner when I saw him. He walked off.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: How'd that go over?WOOD, JR.: He wasn't able to chat about that. That wasn't the time or place. But I really feel like, there has to be some degree of connecting, but I think every base wants that. And I think that's where it comes back to what we've been finding on the road, is that people are concerned about their issue and their issue only. And we've turned into a voter base in this country that is all about what's in it for me and my people first. And you're supposed to vote for the best candidate for the country, not necessarily, which means sometimes it's not the best candidate for yourself or for your group. I think there's still time for Biden to connect with black voters, but I do not.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You do? You do think there's time? WOOD, JR.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: All right, Roy.WOOD, JR.: Jordan, how do you feel about the black people?

utterances.speaker: JORDAN KLEPPER, COMEDIAN AND WRITER
utterances.sentences: What's that? How do I feel about black people? I'm two thumbs up, man.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Welcome, welcome back. We got Jordan and Roy here. Roy, you became a viral moment at the Emmys. What the hell were you saying?WOOD, JR.: Unintentionally. I wasn't saying that. I was just happy.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait. We have evidence. We have evidence. Play the clip.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) WOOD, JR.: And honestly, the person I always thank, because he's just a crazy genius for thinking of it. Hey, Jon Stewart, wherever you are, my friend, thank you for calling me up. Thank you for asking me to come and join you on this crazy journey. And thank you to everybody else in this category. Thank you to these people. We did it, baby. We did it. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What were you saying, Roy?WOOD, JR.: I said, please hire a host. That's all I said. But it wasn't --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Do you mean please hire a host or do you mean please hire me?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No, a host because it was a night that Trevor Noah and the staff and everybody that was on that stage and the crew that was watching back in New York. They work hard. And I was just happy for him. And I'm happy for "The Daily Show". And I'm happy for what the show can be in 2024.So, the idea was, come on, let's get a host and let's get on the road. I wasn't trying to steal a moment. I've apologized to the people who need to be apologized to. Because I wasn't trying to steal that moment that Trevor worked so hard for. But it was said in the spirit of excitement, not trying to -- It wasn't -- the intent was not malicious. It was, let's go, let's do this.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Jordan, I'm going to ask you a question. So, okay, so clearly -- WOOD, JR.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: If you guys, you all not just, I mean, obviously you want to make money, but if you're taking time to talk to your audience, what are you all trying to accomplish with the tour?

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: Well, I will say, I love hanging out with this guy, and so we wanted to go on the road, and literally talk to people. We do get to -- we have the best job in the world. We get to take the news, we get to find what's humorous about it, we get to call out B.S. where we see it. And we oftentimes do that from a studio in New York when you go into Charlottesville, Virginia, you go to Indianapolis, you go to Grand Rapids, Michigan.We're opening it up to be like what do you care about and what's surprising, I think, to us is like, we're comedians who care a lot about the news and hopefully have a point of view about it. We don't get a lot of questions about what was it like to meet Tom Cruise when he came to "The Daily Show." People have real issues. They want to talk.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And they want to talk.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: They want to talk about it and it's also a space where people who want to feel heard and talk to other people about it. I think we're often surprised after the show, people will tell us like, this was cathartic. Like to be in a room with people who we can talk about education issues. And we joke --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Cathartic is the word they use?

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: They use the word cathartic.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Talking to comedians.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: I went to Kalamazoo and -- where I'm from -- and I did a show where I talked about the news. People talked back to me and they said like, we rarely are in places surrounded by 2000 other people who are talking about the things that bother them in the community right now.And we don't create those spaces anymore. And it's- it's a sad state of affairs that happens at a comedy show, but it shows there is a need for community and discussion.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What do they say about the news? I get the impression they don't believe the news, they don't trust the news. What do they tell you about that?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And then they stick with that news. I mean, that's why we're all so siloed, because if you're only listening to one network and only one point of view, then you believe what you're seeing on that one network and that one point of view.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.sentences: And you double down on that because you see other people getting bad news, which makes you believe and hold harder to the news that you have, even if you have doubts. I think like we have a crisis of certainty in this country.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Crisis of certainty.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: And everybody thinks they have it. And I think uncertainty is the only way you can actually have a conversation.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No disrespect to you, Jordan. Roy, Nikki Haley said America's never had racism. I got to let you, you can't, ain't letting you --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: She said it's never been a racist country, yeah.WOOD, JR.: If America's not racist, then Nikki Haley should run for president under her birth name and see what happened. Ask old Vivek Ramaswamy how that went for him in Iowa. They told Ram, what they said in Iowa, Jordan, they were like, yeah, we're not sure about him because we don't know about that name. Too many consonants in your name, Vivek.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Did people say that? Did people say that, seriously?WOOD, JR.: Vivek Ramaswamy, if he'd have showed up to the Iowa caucus as just Gerald, he'd have done way better.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Do you really believe that?WOOD, JR.: Yes, yes. Just Nikki. Simple, single syllable. That's how you got to run when you run.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Nikki is her middle name. Nikki is her middle name, yeah.WOOD, JR.: Okay, that's fair. Well, then put that name right on the front end if it ain't racist.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That's her first name. Yeah.WOOD, JR.: Okay, put it out there then if everything's cool. But she understands that you just got to hit people. You can't hit people with too much.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But she didn't just change her name when she got into politics. She's always been Nikki. She's been Nikki for a long time.WOOD, JR.: Yes, as a Republican in the South.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: Nikki Haley's smart. I think I see that. She's smart. She knows what she's doing, and it shows you she's playing to her audience.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But how do you explain that comment?

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: Because her audience doesn't. KINGracist?

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: I think she knows her audience doesn't want to hear it. Right now we've created this firestorm around wokeism in a way that like the audience doesn't want to hear any negativity about what they believe or anything in the past. Don't tear down these statues.And so she knows her audience doesn't want any of that criticism and she plays to it. She knows she doesn't believe it. I don't think she believes it. I think she plays to it. I think that's what's so scary. We're playing to the basest mob mentality.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But you don't think she really believes that. That's interesting.

utterances.speaker: KLEPPER
utterances.sentences: I think she's playing the game.WOOD, JR.: She cannot believe that and not have been running the state of South Carolina. That's not possible.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We couldn't find it. I haven't found anybody that agrees with that statement.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I hope not.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Thank you, guys. I hope not, too.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, before we go, I really want to talk about a moment from this week's Emmy Awards that stood out. Niecy Nash won the Emmy for Outstanding Actress in a Limited Series or Movie for her performance. The movie was called "Dahmer- MonsterShe delivered an acceptance speech that really resonated with a whole lot of people, myself included, because of who she thanked. And you know who I want to thank? I want to thank me for believing in me. And doing what they said I could not do. And I want to say to myself in front of all you beautiful people, go on girl with your bad set. You did that. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, you did that. We actually have Niecy now. She's joining us now from Dublin, Ireland, where she's just landed working on her next project. Niecy, congratulations, congratulations. We're giving you a round of applause. So, Niecy, you should know you're out of the country, but you've become a meme. And I'll bet you had no idea you would get that kind of reaction. Andwe should say you thanked other people. But you also thanked yourself. And when I watched you, I said, boy, I can't believe she did that. B, I'm glad she did that. And I would never have the nerve to do that. What were you thinking in that moment?

utterances.speaker: NIECY NASH, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: First of all, let me just say the reason why I have these sunglasses on --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I was wondering. I was wondering.

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: I have been crying all day. I'm just so full and so overwhelmed. I look like one of those teenage girls in a rom-com when the boy just broke up with her and the eyes get so weird. That is how I look. Happy tears, but I look a wreck. So, I'm just trying to spare your audience.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay, because I was going to ask you, Niecy do you want to leave your sunglasses on? But okay, I get it, I get it.

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: I look a mess. The night, if I could sum it up in one word, was magical. But I had no idea that my words were taking flight. Because after you win, they usher you in the back. You have to do a couple of interviews. You got to take pictures. By the time I came all the way around to come back, the thing was over.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: And you get ushered into the next party so you can get your name engraved on the statue. So, I didn't know it was unfolding the way it was until, I don't know, maybe around two or three o'clock in the morning.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: You know, I've been to the big show a couple of times, Charles, and I walked away empty-handed. So, you never know how it's going to go. But I looked over at my better half. I said, listen, if they don't call my name, I'm going to spit on the ground, and we walking out.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No, no, you would not. No. Jessica would not let you do that.

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: I was just making jokes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I know you were.

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: I was just making jokes just to keep it light. But, you know. I was very, very happy when they called my name. KINGpeople to understand, because I so admire that you did that. You know, as girls were raised, you don't want to brag, you don't want to toot your own horn, but you thanked yourself, why? Was there something that happened in your life or that was going on in your life that you said, you know what, I'ma thank me?

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: Because I know -- because I know what it cost me. You know, I know -- I just know trying to prove myself to my peers and going through the stuff that you go through in life that people don't see. They don't see what happens behind the closed doors. They don't see the pain. They don't see your heartache.All they see is the shiny parts of your life. And it took a long time for me to get there in that moment. And I was proud of myself, you know, I still am, you know, I really am.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, Niecy, I talked to a lot of young teens in my life and going over the notes about you, you talk about self-esteem. Cause I said, you guys spend so much time worrying about what some fool on the internet says about you. I say it's called self-esteem.You're never going to be happy as a person until you're able to look yourself in the mirror. Tell me why you think like that because it was beautiful to listen when I was going over the notes.

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: Because you know for some reason, we've inverted it you know. And you know, and we look to other people to affirm, you know, mama esteem. That's not what it is. Them esteem, us esteem, you know, no, it's your own self. And when they told me, you know, you got a cute face, but can you lose weight? I was like, no, and I'm about to go home and get pregnant. Now, how about that?You know? I mean, I just I kept just bucking back and I'm like, you're not going to -- you're not going to break me. And when you tell me that you're going another way, and I'm not your choice, and there was a better name or this or that, I am not from an arrogant place, but from a place that I know the call on my life, I think I feel sorry for you, because I will be something one day. And you don't wish me a chance.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And Niecy, the other thing is you know how hard you worked to get to this moment. And I'll close with this because after that, you said you were going to go skinny dipping with your wife and you were going to take the Emmy with you. Do you want to let us know how the night ended?

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: Baby, like a dream. Newborn baby naked in the swimming pool with champagne and that trophy to bear witness. And we had a good time. I married the right woman.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And you are still having a good time working in Dublin. Niecy, thank you so much, because it's late there. I really, really, we really appreciate you taking the time.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You go girl, congratulations. KING

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: Go on, girl, with your bag.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Go on. Thank you, Niecy. Thank you. Yep, she literally, she's in her hotel room. I think she's still floating. And before we go, here's a video Niecy was talking about.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: NASH
utterances.sentences: I'm going skinny-dipping. Okay, I booked a hotel suite that has an indoor swimming pool. Get into that. Now I'm just waiting for my better half. So we can really get the party started.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Look, they're even playing the song, "There's a Party Going --". You've won an Emmy before. Did you go skinny dipping with your Emmy, dear?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, me and skinny have never been using the same sentence before. It was more dipping, not skinny dipping.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It was more skinny than dipping. I got it.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: One more thing, every Wednesday night, we always go outside and talk with people on the streets. It was very cold tonight. It was tough tonight.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: I sent a picture of you guys to my mom.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, did you?

utterances.speaker: MOLLY
utterances.sentences: I said, I hope you don't take offense, I sent a picture. I said, Gail King's here with some guy. And she goes, gee, I don't like sports.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm some guy, y'all.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Hello, some guy. I think I should go around telling people, you're my little boo thing. You know that song, Charles? BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You're my little boo thing?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That was so awesome. I love that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You weren't upset?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Hell no.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That's my little boo thing for you. That'll wrap up our first show of the week. We both thought that was very funny. Thank you, Molly, for that moment. We thank you for joining us, our first show of the year. Guess what? We get to come back next Wednesday. We thank you for watching King Charles. You can catch me tomorrow morning on CBS mornings at 7 A.M. Got to get up early, so I'm going to bed. Where are you going tonight?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm just going to bed. I got to go to my real job tomorrow.
